# Introduction

This project is an examination of early 1900s (~1890-1906) groundwater conditions in the Columbia Plateau Aquifer System (Washington State) as compared to present day (2010-2021).

The purpose of this Rmd is to: 

1) Prep data for input to ArcGIS (for hydrogeological analysis & DEM): data prepped in `sd_modern_data_cleaning.Rmd` 
2) After ArcGIS processing: 

1) Determine well-aquifer classification 
2) Compare artesian conditions

## ArcGIS Data Analysis

The following steps were performed in ArcGIS:

Hydrogeological data: Arcfile = "columbia_classify" (ArcPro)

1.  Hydrogeologic layers (raster files)
2.  Modern wells from aquifer system (USGS) (processed in Rmd
    `modern_data_cleaning.Rmd`) and early 1900s data
    (early1900s_dem_wgs84_final.txt)
3.  Use tool "Extract multi values to points" to determine well location
    intersection with geological raster layers
4.  Export resulting well data as a text files

## Data Analysis (Post-Arc)

### Hydrogeological data

```{r}
# Read in modern data file from Arc 

columbia_mod_fromarc <- readr::read_csv(here::here("data", "columbia", "columbia_mod_classify.txt")) %>% 
  clean_names()

# Read in early 1900s data file from Arc 

early1900s_fromarc <- readr::read_csv(here::here("data", "columbia", "columbia_1900_classify.txt"), guess_max = 6653) %>% 
  clean_names()

```

### Columbia Plateau Aquifer Information 

Hydrologic Model Layer Surfaces:

- Overburden (surficial) (obtop) 
- Saddle Mountains Basalt (smtop) 
- Wanapum Basalt (wntop) 
- Grande Ronde Basalt (grtop) 
- Older Bedrock (pmtop) 


### Aquifer analysis 

- Find well bottom 

```{r}
# Convert `rastervalu` column from meters to feet (conversion: 1 meter = 3.28084 feet)
# Add a column that is elevation minus well depth
# Add a column that is elevation minus well water level 

# Modern data 

cp_analysis_mod <- columbia_mod_fromarc %>% 
  mutate(topo_ft = rastervalu * 3.28084) %>% 
  mutate(well_bottom = topo_ft - well_depth_va) %>% 
   mutate(keep = 
           ifelse(is.na(obtop_f) & is.na(smtop_f) & is.na(wntop_f) & is.na(grtop_f) & is.na(pmtop_f), "NA", "keep")) %>% 
  filter(!keep == "NA")

 
# 1900 data 

cp_analysis_1900 <- early1900s_fromarc %>% 
  mutate(topo_ft = ned10m_bilinear_cusa_albers102003 * 3.28084) %>% 
  mutate(well_bottom = topo_ft - well_depth_ft) %>% 
  mutate(keep = 
           ifelse(is.na(obtop_f) & is.na(smtop_f) & is.na(wntop_f) & is.na(grtop_f) & is.na(pmtop_f), "NA", "keep")) %>% 
  filter(!keep == "NA")

```

#### Classify each well to an aquifer unit 

Theory: 

well bottom < top of Overburden (obtop) & well bottom > top of Saddle Mtns Basalt (smtop) = Overburden (ob) 
well bottom < top of Saddle Mtns Basalt (smtop) & well bottom > top of Wanapum Basalt (wntop) = Saddle Mountains Basalt (smb) 
well bottom < top of Wanapum Basalt (wntop) & well bottom > top of Grande Ronde Basalt (grtop) = Wanapum Basalt (wnb) 
well bottom < top of Grande Ronde Basalt (grtop) & well bottom > top of Older Bedrock (pmtop) = Grande Ronde Basalt (grb) 
well bottom < top of Older Bedrock = Older Bedrock (pmb) 


Top Only Analysis 

```{r}
# Classify wells into their aquifer units 

# Modern data 

cp_class_mod <- cp_analysis_mod %>% 
  rowwise() %>%
   mutate(aquifer = 
        ifelse(well_bottom <= obtop_f & well_bottom >= max(smtop_f, wntop_f, grtop_f, pmtop_f,
                                                          na.rm = TRUE), "ob", 
        ifelse(well_bottom <= smtop_f & well_bottom >= max(wntop_f, grtop_f, pmtop_f,
                                                          na.rm = TRUE), "smb", 
        ifelse(well_bottom <= wntop_f & well_bottom >= max(grtop_f, pmtop_f,
                                                          na.rm = TRUE), "wnb",
        ifelse(well_bottom <= grtop_f & well_bottom >= max(pmtop_f, na.rm = TRUE), "grtop", 
        ifelse(well_bottom <= pmtop_f, "pmb", NA))))))

# 1900 data 

cp_class_1900 <- cp_analysis_1900 %>% 
  rowwise() %>%
   mutate(aquifer = 
        ifelse(well_bottom <= obtop_f & well_bottom >= max(smtop_f, wntop_f, grtop_f, pmtop_f,
                                                          na.rm = TRUE), "ob", 
        ifelse(well_bottom <= smtop_f & well_bottom >= max(wntop_f, grtop_f, pmtop_f,
                                                          na.rm = TRUE), "smb", 
        ifelse(well_bottom <= wntop_f & well_bottom >= max(grtop_f, pmtop_f,
                                                          na.rm = TRUE), "wnb",
        ifelse(well_bottom <= grtop_f & well_bottom >= max(pmtop_f, na.rm = TRUE), "grtop", 
        ifelse(well_bottom <= pmtop_f, "pmb", NA))))))

```

### Separate each aquifer/unit and confined

Confining units: Mabton and Vantage Interbeds (no GIS data), associated with Saddle Mountain Basalt and Wanapum Basalt respectively (Burns et al., 2011). 

#### Modern Data

```{r}
# Confining unit criteria 
# Must have confining unit above to be considered a confined well 
# Just SMB as confining unit 

confined_criteria_mod <- cp_class_mod %>% 
  rowwise() %>% 
  mutate(status = 
           ifelse(is.na(aquifer), NA,
           ifelse(aquifer %in% c("ob","smb"), "unconfined", 
           ifelse(aquifer == "wnb" & is.na(smtop_f), "unconfined",
           ifelse(aquifer == "wnb" & !is.na(smtop_f), "confined",
           ifelse(aquifer == "grtop" & (!is.na(smtop_f) | !is.na(wntop_f)), "confined",
           ifelse(aquifer == "pmb" & (!is.na(smtop_f) | !is.na(wntop_f)), "confined", "unconfined")))))))

```

#### 1900 Data

Just confining unit above

```{r}
# Confining unit criteria 
# Must have confining unit above to be considered a confined well 
# Can include confining units (except the uppermost, VKBG) 

confined_criteria_1900 <- cp_class_1900 %>% 
  rowwise() %>% 
  mutate(status = 
           ifelse(is.na(aquifer), NA,
           ifelse(aquifer %in% c("ob","smb"), "unconfined", 
           ifelse(aquifer == "wnb" & is.na(smtop_f), "unconfined",
           ifelse(aquifer == "wnb" & !is.na(smtop_f), "confined",
           ifelse(aquifer == "grtop" & (!is.na(smtop_f) | !is.na(wntop_f)), "confined",
           ifelse(aquifer == "pmb" & (!is.na(smtop_f) | !is.na(wntop_f)), "confined", "unconfined")))))))

```

### Accuracy check with USGS Confined/Unconfined 

#### Modern data only 

n = 7 for confined USGS wells w/ classification...therefore we decided that a sample size less than 10 is too small to do the error analysis

```{r}
# Check to see accuracy of confined/unconfined

cp_modern_check <- confined_criteria_mod %>%
  rowwise() %>%
  mutate(check =
           ifelse(status == "confined" & code %in% c("Confined single aquifer", "Confined multiple aquifers"), "true_c",
           ifelse(status == "confined" & is.na(code), "no_data_c",
           ifelse(status == "confined" & code %in% c("Unconfined single aquifer", "Unconfined multiple aquifer"), "wrong_c",
           ifelse(status == "unconfined" & is.na(code), "no_data_uc",
           ifelse(status == "unconfined" & code %in% c("Unconfined single aquifer", "Unconfined multiple aquifer"), "true_uc",
           ifelse(status == "unconfined" & code %in% c("Confined single aquifer", "Confined multiple aquifers"), "wrong_uc",
                                                  NA)))))))

# Summary
summary_check <- cp_modern_check %>%
  group_by(check) %>%
  count(check)

```

### Summary tables 

##### Modern Data 

```{r}
# Final summaries of "correct" data 

# Modern data

# Confined/unconfined and artesian by aquifer unit

summary_mod_final_art <- cp_modern_check %>% 
  filter(!check %in% c("wrong_uc", "wrong_c")) %>% 
  group_by(aquifer, status, artesian) %>% 
  count(aquifer) %>% 
  filter(!is.na(status))

# Pivot wider 

mod_final_wide <- pivot_wider(summary_mod_final_art, 
                          names_from = c(status, artesian), 
                          values_from = n) %>% 
  mutate(total_n = rowSums(across(where(is.numeric)), na.rm = T)) %>% 
  rowwise() %>% 
  mutate(total_c = sum(c(confined_0, confined_1), na.rm = T)) %>% 
  mutate(per_c = (total_c / total_n) *100) %>% 
  mutate(per_art = (confined_1 / total_c) *100)

# Tidy the table 

mod_final_table <- mod_final_wide %>% 
  select(aquifer, total_n, total_c, per_c, confined_1, per_art, confined_0) %>% 
  replace(is.na(.), 0) %>% 
  mutate_if(is.numeric, round, digits = 2) %>% 
  unite(confined_wells, c("total_c", "per_c"), sep = "  |  ") %>% 
  unite(artesian_wells, c("confined_1", "per_art"), sep = "  |  ") %>% 
  rename("Aquifer Units" = "aquifer", 
         "N wells" = "total_n", 
         "Number of wells defined as confined" = "confined_wells", 
         "Artesian confined flowing wells" = "artesian_wells",
         "Not artesian" = "confined_0") 


# Write to file 
write_csv(mod_final_table, here::here("output_data", "columbia", "mod_final_table.txt"))
  
```

```{r echo = FALSE, results = 'asis'}

# Display knitted table 

kable(mod_final_table, caption = "Table 1. Modern (2010-2021) confined and artesian wells of the Columbia Plateau")
```
